alert.note: Alert for Carroll; City of Galax; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 1:12PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory In Effect for parts of Grayson and Carroll Counties in Virginia, The City of Galax, and Alleghany County in North Carolina until 3 PM EDT This Afternoon... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in northwest North Carolina, Alleghany NC. In southwest Virginia, Carroll, City of Galax and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a persistent developing area of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall extending from Piney Creek to Independence to Galax to Hillsville, moving east-northeast around 20 mph. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in minor flooding within the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have already fallen in this area and an additional 1 to 2 inches is possible during the next couple of hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Reed Island Creek, Crooked Creek, Crab Fork, Chestnut Creek, Bull Run, Brannon Branch, Beaver Creek, Cranberry Creek, Burks Fork, Dixon Branch, East Fork Crooked Creek, Brush Creek, Beaverdam Creek, and Bridle Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Galax... Hillsville... Independence... Fries... Fancy Gap... Pipers Gap... Baywood... - For additional information on flooding, creek, stream, and river levels please go to our web page located at http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
